alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 5:21PM MST until August 22 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Arizona, including the following county, Coconino. * WHEN...Until 845 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 519 PM MST, local law enforcement reported flooding in Tusayan due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing. - Tusayan is experiencing flooding. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Coconino Wash, Cottonwood Creek, Cremation Creek, Garden Creek, Pipe Creek, Little Red Horse Wash, Bright Angel Wash, Colorado River and Grapevine Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tusayan, Grand Canyon Airport, Pipe Creek Vista, Yaki Point, Grand Canyon - South Rim, Grandview Point, Grand Canyon National Park and Ten-x Campground. - This includes State Route 64 between mile markers 227 and 237. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
